Our chipper blades are manufactured from: Our chipper blades are manufactured from premium chromium steel containing a minimum of 8% chromium for exceptional hardness and wear resistance. Material options include cost-effective carbon steel, standard chromium steel, premium tool steels (WNr.1.2235, K306, K329), and carbide-inlay designs for maximum durability. Each material is certified and traceable for quality assurance.
Blades are cut to precise dimensions usi: Blades are cut to precise dimensions using advanced sawing and milling equipment. Bolt holes and mounting features are drilled with precision positioning for proper fitment. The rectangular blade shape (typically 40-100mm width x 150-800mm length) is machined to tight tolerances ensuring proper installation and balanced cutting forces across the chipper drum or disk.
Blades undergo precision heat treatment: Blades undergo precision heat treatment in vacuum furnaces to achieve optimal hardness of HRC 54-57. The controlled heating, quenching, and tempering process ensures uniform hardness throughout the blade while maintaining core toughness to resist impact from rocks and metal contaminants. This process is critical for achieving the balance of edge retention and durability required for industrial chipping operations.
Final grinding creates the cutting edge: Final grinding creates the cutting edge with proper bevel angle and sharpness for optimal chipping performance. Each blade undergoes comprehensive inspection including dimensional verification, hardness testing, edge straightness measurement, and visual inspection for defects. Quality certifications and material traceability documentation are provided with each order to ensure consistent performance.

Common questions about wood chipper blad: Common questions about wood chipper blades
Blade life varies significantly based on: Blade life varies significantly based on wood type, material diameter, presence of dirt/rocks, and maintenance practices. In clean wood applications, chromium steel blades typically last 150-300 hours of continuous operation. Carbide-inlay blades can last 800-1200 hours when avoiding metal contaminants. Proper blade maintenance, rotation, and avoiding dirt-contaminated wood maximize blade life.
Yes, chipper blades can be professionall: Yes, chipper blades can be professionally sharpened multiple times before replacement. Most blades can be resharpened 3-6 times depending on wear severity and original blade thickness. Professional sharpening services restore proper bevel angle and edge geometry. Regular sharpening before severe dulling occurs maximizes total blade life and maintains optimal chip quality. We offer sharpening services with quick turnaround.
Signs include larger chip sizes, increas: Signs include larger chip sizes, increased power consumption, excessive fines or dust, visible edge rounding or nicks, and increased feeding force required. Inspect blades every 50-100 operating hours for wear. Replace or sharpen when cutting edge shows significant rounding or if nicks exceed 3mm depth. Rotating blade positions during inspection helps ensure even wear across all cutting edges.
For occasional use with clean wood, carb: For occasional use with clean wood, carbon steel offers good value. For professional/commercial operations, chromium steel (8%+ Cr) provides the best balance of performance and cost. For high-volume production or abrasive applications, consider premium tool steels. Carbide-inlay blades are recommended for maximum productivity in continuous operations despite higher initial cost. Our team can recommend optimal materials based on your specific usage patterns.
Check your chipper's operator manual for: Check your chipper's operator manual for blade specifications including length, width, thickness, and bolt hole pattern. Measure existing blades if manual is unavailable. Provide chipper brand and model number - we maintain specifications for most major brands (Vermeer, Bandit, Morbark, etc.). Send us photos or measurements of existing blades for confirmation. We can cross-reference and provide exact replacement blades.
Yes, comprehensive installation instruct: Yes, comprehensive installation instructions, torque specifications, and maintenance guidelines are provided with blade orders. We offer technical support for proper blade installation, adjustment, and troubleshooting. Safety information and best practices documentation are included. Our technical team is available to answer questions about blade installation, sharpening schedules, and performance optimization for your specific application.
Get detailed specifications, dimensional: Get detailed specifications, dimensional charts, material grades, and compatibility information for our complete range of wood chipper blades. Includes maintenance guidelines and troubleshooting tips.
